fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-64991].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
JIRA Health Checks gives a warning on End of Life as per the below. 
{quote}
JIRA version 7.0.x is approaching End Of Life. Please plan to upgrade Confluence within 179 days.
{quote}

Note the JIRA version and the product that it ask to upgrade.

h3. Environment
* JIRA 7.0.10
* JIRA Instance Health Plugin 2.4.1

h3. Steps to reproduce
# Install JIRA 7.0.10
# Update Support tools plugin to 3.10
# Update JIRA Instance Health plugin to 2.4.1

h3. Actual Results
{code:borderStyle=dashed}
JIRA version 7.0.x is approaching End Of Life. Please plan to upgrade Confluence within 179 days.
{code}

h3. Expected Results
No warning. 191 days to go for JIRA 7.0 EOL.

h3. Notes
JIRA 7.3.3 with JIRA Instance Health 2.4.1 does not encounter this.

h3. Workaround

This was fixed by updating an external REST endpoint. If the error is still present, deleting the {{jira-healthcheck-eol.json}} in the {{$JIRA_HOME}} directory and re-running the check will update the file with the correct date.
fields.summary: End of Life Health Checks gives wrong information

fields.description:
h3. Summary
If an account exists in JIRA that shares the e-mail address with one being used by a mail handler, the *CC Assignee* function will not work properly.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Configure a incoming mail server on the instance.
# Create a mail handler with the *CC Assignee* function active.
# Create a user account which uses the same e-mail address as the one used in the incoming mail server configuration.
# Send a e-mail to create a issue in JIRA with a user's e-mail address as CC.

h3. Expected Results
Issue is created and assigned to the CC'ed user.

h3. Actual Results
Issue will be created and assigned to the account that shares the e-mail address with the incoming mail server configuration. This will be the case even if no user is set as the CC on the e-mail.

*Note*
Even if the user does not have any access to JIRA and is not set to be an assignable user, the incoming mail handler can still set the user as the assignee, see related bug: JRASERVER-65403
* This is due to granting "Assignable User" permission to "Application User - Any Logged in User"

h3.Workaround
Change the e-mail address of the account that shares it with the mail server.
fields.summary: Issues wrongfully assigned if account shares e-mail with JIRA's incoming mail server

h4. Summary

In order to link either another JIRA issue or a Confluence page to an issue, an end-user attempts to open the "Link" dialog, either by choosing "More" > "Link", or by using the dot-dialog and typing "Link".
h4. Expected results

The Link issue dialog appears, allowing the user to link either a JIRA issue or Confluence page.
h4. Actual results

The page is dimmed and a spinner appears over the page. The spinner never disappears.
h5. Additional observations

When checking the HTTP requests and responses for the page, one (or more) batch.js files have an error response of: HTTP 400 "Bad Request".

fields.description:
h3. Summary
JIRA can stuck installing plugin due to *FelixFrameworkWiring* deadlock with another thread. 
Code in {{com.atlassian.plugin.manager.DefaultPluginManager.removePluginFromLoader}} doesn't handle this problem.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Install JIRA with App-Dynamics 
# Update JIRA Service Desk

h3. Expected Results
Plugin update will finish successfully 

h3. Actual Results
Plugin update failed, *UpmAsynchronousTaskManager:thread-1* is stuck forever.
Status from thread-dump:
{noformat}
"UpmAsynchronousTaskManager:thread-1" #324 prio=5 os_prio=0 tid=0x00007f461c054000 nid=0xb431 in Object.wait() [0x00007f45dd2b9000]
   java.lang.Thread.State: WAITING (on object monitor)
	at java.lang.Object.wait(Native Method)
	at java.lang.Object.wait(Object.java:502)
	at org.apache.felix.framework.Felix.acquireBundleLock(Felix.java:5039)
	- locked <0x000000054fdf2320> (a [Ljava.lang.Object;)
	at org.apache.felix.framework.Felix.uninstallBundle(Felix.java:2606)
	at org.apache.felix.framework.BundleImpl.uninstall(BundleImpl.java:1022)
	at com.atlassian.plugin.osgi.factory.OsgiPlugin.uninstallInternal(OsgiPlugin.java:494)
	at com.atlassian.plugin.impl.AbstractPlugin.uninstall(AbstractPlugin.java:452)
	at com.atlassian.plugin.loaders.ScanningPluginLoader.removePlugin(ScanningPluginLoader.java:184)
	at com.atlassian.plugin.loaders.ForwardingPluginLoader.removePlugin(ForwardingPluginLoader.java:52)
	at com.atlassian.plugin.loaders.PermissionCheckingPluginLoader.removePlugin(PermissionCheckingPluginLoader.java:39)
	at com.atlassian.plugin.manager.DefaultPluginManager.removePluginFromLoader(DefaultPluginManager.java:1060)
{noformat}
 
h3. Notes
Sequense of events: 
# JIRA tries to install updates for plugin 
# During installing one the dependencies (*atlassian-timed-promise-plugin*) it failed due to deadlock between other threads
#* Threads: *FelixFrameworkWiring* and *AD Thread Pool-Global0*
{code:borderStyle=solid}
Found one Java-level deadlock:
=============================
"FelixFrameworkWiring":
  waiting to lock monitor 0x00007f472c4e0e18 (object 0x0000000563386730, a org.apache.felix.framework.BundleRevisionImpl),
  which is held by "AD Thread Pool-Global0"
"AD Thread Pool-Global0":
  waiting to lock monitor 0x00007f4b78013ab8 (object 0x0000000563385e70, a org.apache.felix.framework.BundleImpl),
  which is held by "FelixFrameworkWiring"
{code}
* thread *UpmAsynchronousTaskManager:thread-1* has not affected by that at this point
* but when it tries to install next plugin 'com.atlassian.servicedesk' it's stuck forever. 

There are two problems:
* _AppDynamic_ has caused deadlock (this could be due bug in _Felix_)
* Code in {{com.atlassian.plugin.manager.DefaultPluginManager.removePluginFromLoader}} doesn't handle this problem - scope of this ticket. 

h3.Workaround
Restart JIRA
fields.summary: JIRA can stuck installing plugin due to FelixFrameworkWiring deadlock

h3. Summary
When the user has configured a Select list (Single Choice) custom field with options containing the character "İ" (Azerbaijani language), JIRA will throw an error when attempting to search for the option.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new Select list (Single Choice) custom field named *DEMO*.
# Add the character "İ" as a new option. Eg. "*Problem with İ*".
# Associate the custom field with the issue screens.
# Create a new test issue with this option "*Problem with İ*" for *DEMO*.
# Go to the Issue navigator and search for: *DEMO = "Problem with İ"*.

h3. Expected Results
The issue navigator will return the issues with "*Problem with İ*" selected for *DEMO*.

h3. Actual Results
No issues are returned and JIRA throws the error "*The option 'Problem with İ' for field 'DEMO' does not exist.*"
 
h3. Notes
Tested it with the *Dfile.encoding=utf-8* and *-Dsun.jnu.encoding=UTF-8* startup parameters therefore it does not seem to be an encoding issue.
fields.summary: JIRA is not able to search for words containing the character "İ" as a Single Select custom field option.

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-64976].
  {panel}

Please improve [Installing+JIRA+Data+Center|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AdminJIRAServer073/Installing+JIRA+Data+Center] documentation page.
Suggested changes: 
* Include section about ports used by JIRA DC, see as a example: https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/42692523/what-is-the-random-port-opened-by-jira-datacenter-used-for-and-what-is-the-range-of-choices
** Main idea: JDC in addition to usual ports used by JIRA used 2 more ports for Ehcache: _40001_ and _40011_ (_TCP ephemeral port_) 
*** Note for 7.2: JDC in addition to usual ports used by JIRA used 2 more ports for Ehcache: _40001_ and _dynamic (_TCP ephemeral port_) 
* Include firewall recommendation, partially done in _Security_ section 
** Until feature request JRA-64974 is implemented, large range of ports needs to be open (depends on OS, see [TCP ephemeral port|https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ephemeral_port]). 
** In JIRA 7.3 specific ports can be used
fields.summary: Include firewall configuration into JIRA DC docs

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-64974].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
JIRA Datacenter (JDC) uses Ehcache as caching technology, cache server which exposes available cache operations remotely through RMI. Ehcache requires two port for it's network operations, _RMICacheManagerPeerListener_ paramets
* hostName - may be null, in which case the hostName will be looked up.
* port - a port in the range 1025 - 65536
* remoteObjectPort - the port number on which the remote objects bound in the registry receive calls. This defaults to a free port if not specified.
* cacheManager - the CacheManager this listener belongs to
* socketTimeoutMillis - TCP/IP Socket timeout when waiting on response

see: http://www.ehcache.org/apidocs/2.6.9/net/sf/ehcache/distribution/RMICacheManagerPeerListener.html

Currently in JDC you can specify only *port* (default = 40001, setting: ehcache.listener.port), see [Cluster.properties file parameters|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Installing+JIRA+Data+Center#InstallingJIRADataCenter-Security]
Another *remoteObjectPort* is dynamically allocated and [TCP ephemeral port|https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ephemeral_port] is selected. So you need to open wide range of port at firewall. 

Without opening the port, the following error is displayed as other nodes start up :
{code}2017-03-22 11:53:38,023 ehcache-replicator-0 WARN      [c.a.j.cluster.distribution.JiraCacheManagerPeerProvider] Looking up rmiUrl //ip-x-x-x-x:40001/com.atlassian.jira.project.util.CachingProjectKeyStore.cache threw a connection exception. This could mean that a node has gone offline  or it may indicate network connectivity difficulties. Details: Connection refused to host: ip-x-x-x-x; nested exception is:
        java.net.ConnectException: Connection timed out
{code}

h3. Suggested Solution
Add option to specify *remoteObjectPort* (RMI port)

h3. See related links:
* https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/42692523/what-is-the-random-port-opened-by-jira-datacenter-used-for-and-what-is-the-range-of-choices
* https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Java_remote_method_invocation
* https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ephemeral_port

h3. Workaround 
Open all *Ephemeral_port* range in firewall and allow connection from all JDC nodes. 

h3. Feature introduced in JIRA 7.3
New variable: *ehcache.object.port*
{panel:title=cluster.properties}
...
ehcache.object.port = 40011
{panel}

Note: If not defined an ephemeral port is used, see JRASERVER-66608 

Ticket to update docs: JRA-64976
fields.summary: Add the ability to customize the ehcache object port in Jira Data Center
Improve JIRA Datacenter node replication documentation

It would be cool if there's a separate field "external links" which identifies and shows all other links to connected to an issue (e.g. Confluence pages, websites, etc..).

 

Does such a function already exist? Lemme know ;) Do not hesitate to ask us any further questions.

Best wishes

Christopher from EPOS CAT GmbH

h3. Problem Definition
If we make a call to JIRA without any active logon for such as *HTTP://localhost:8080/rest/menu/latest/admin/* we will be presented with below data:
{code}
[{"key":"admin","link":"http://localhost:8080/secure/project/ViewProjects.jspa","label":"Your Company JIRA administration","tooltip":"","local":true,"self":true,"applicationType":"jira"}]
{code}

h3. Suggested Solution

Currently, the information shown when running the rest call might make the customer think that there is a security issue at their end which might cause unnecessary panic at their end.

No workaround is available at the moment

fields.description:
h4. +Problem Statement+

In JIRA 7.3 API, method [getCustomFieldObjectsByName()|https://docs.atlassian.com/jira/7.3.0/com/atlassian/jira/issue/CustomFieldManager.html#getCustomFieldObjectsByName-java.lang.String-] doesn't accept the right input parameter.
h4. +Expected behavior+

The method is supposed to accept input parameter and return output value in the following manner:
h5. - For input parameter
 * If there's a translation for the custom field name in the user's profile language, the translated name will be the input parameter
 * If there's no translation for the custom field name in the user's profile language, the untranslated name will be the input parameter

h5. - For output value
 * If there's a translation for the custom field name in the user's profile language, the translated name will be the output value
 * If there's no translation for the custom field name in the user's profile language, the untranslated name will be the output value

h4. +Actual behavior+

(/) The output value is currently working as expected:
 * The returned value will be the translated name of the field if available in the user's profile language - if not, the untranslated name will be returned

(x) The input parameter is however working in an unexpected manner:
 * If a custom field is not yet renamed or renamed by a user whereby there's no translation for it in the user's profile language, then the untranslated name of the field is accepted by getCustomFieldObjectsByName()
 * If a custom field is renamed by a user whereby there's a translation for it in the user's profile language, then the translated name of the field in that language is accepted by getCustomFieldObjectsByName()

----
*_Example:_*

If there's a translation for a field in Spanish and Japanese, but not in French, then no matter whether the field has been renamed and who did that:
 * If a user with Spanish language runs the method, the translated name in Spanish should be the input parameter
 * If a user with Japanese language runs the method, the translated name in Japanese should be the input parameter
 * If a user with French language runs the method, the untranslated name should be the input parameter

(!) However, currently, if a Japanese user renames the field, then the input parameter will always be the translated name in Japanese, which is unknown to users with other languages.
fields.summary: Method getCustomFieldObjectsByName() doesn't accept the right input parameter

fields.description:
h3. Summary

From troubleshooting PS-11297 we found that a 3rd party addon able to create an empty name custom field through the [CachingCustomFieldManager|https://stash.atlassian.com/projects/JIRASERVER/repos/jira/browse/jira-components/jira-core/src/main/java/com/atlassian/jira/issue/managers/CachingCustomFieldManager.java#159] (which is public API). JIRA does not appear to handle empty custom field names under normal use and throw NPE below. 

{code:borderStyle=solid}
atlassian-jira.log-java.lang.NullPointerException
atlassian-jira.log-     at java.lang.String$CaseInsensitiveComparator.compare(String.java:1192)
atlassian-jira.log-     at java.lang.String$CaseInsensitiveComparator.compare(String.java:1186)
atlassian-jira.log-     at java.util.TreeMap.getEntryUsingComparator(TreeMap.java:376)
atlassian-jira.log-     at java.util.TreeMap.getEntry(TreeMap.java:345)
atlassian-jira.log-     at java.util.TreeMap.containsKey(TreeMap.java:232)
atlassian-jira.log-     at java.util.TreeSet.contains(TreeSet.java:234)
atlassian-jira.log-     at java.util.Collections$UnmodifiableCollection.contains(Collections.java:1032)
atlassian-jira.log-     at com.atlassian.jira.issue.search.constants.SystemSearchConstants.isSystemName(SystemSearchConstants.java:404)
atlassian-jira.log-     at com.atlassian.jira.issue.search.ClauseNames.forCustomField(ClauseNames.java:74)
atlassian-jira.log-     at com.atlassian.jira.issue.fields.CustomFieldImpl.getClauseNames(CustomFieldImpl.java:392)
atlassian-jira.log-     at com.atlassian.jira.issue.customfields.searchers.UserPickerGroupSearcher.init(UserPickerGroupSearcher.java:122)
atlassian-jira.log-     at com.atlassian.jira.issue.customfields.searchers.UserPickerGroupSearcher.init(UserPickerGroupSearcher.java:51) 
{code}

This cause gadget, issue navigator, issue pages, ServiceDesk page return a 500 error page.

{code}
2017-03-08 00:44:31,295 ListenableFutureAdapter-thread-35 WARN c_pcharb 44x4681x5 1czcfc7 216.82.251.234,172.18.11.188,172.18.12.171 /rest/dev-status/1.0/issue/summary [atlassian.jira.index.AccumulatingResultBuilder] com.atlassian.cache.CacheException: com.atlassian.cache.CacheException: java.lang.NullPointerException
{code}

h3. Environment
* JIRA 6.4.10 + JEP 4.10.0

h3. Steps to Reproduce

(i) The following is to demonstrate that a 3rd party add-on is able to create an empty name field. 

# sign in as non-administrator user
# and add "JEP - Total Resolutions per User Bar Chart" gadget 

You will see the gadget returns 500 error in the dashboard

!500.png|thumbnail! 

In the _Administration >> Audit log_, we see the *non-admin* user created a custom field  the user created 

!jep-audit.png|thumbnail!

In the database, it creates a null name custom field 

{code:borderStyle=solid}
jira6410000=# select customfieldtypekey, description, cfname from customfield where cfname is null;
       customfieldtypekey        |                                description                                 | cfname
---------------------------------+----------------------------------------------------------------------------+--------
 plugin.jep:last-resolution-user | This is a lookup field that displays the last user that resolved the issue |
(1 row) 
{code}

h3. Expected Result

JIRA should not allow an exposed API that allow 3rd party add on to create an empty name custom field

h3. Actual Result

3rd party add on able to create empty name custom field that result in hours of outages.
fields.summary: CachingCustomFieldManager allows creation of custom field with empty name

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-64954].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently, Atlassian applications are using a variety of recommended database collations when using MSSQL Server ([JRA-62362|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-62362]). For example, JIRA requires case-insensitive, accent-insensitive collation while Confluence requires case-sensitive, accent-sensitive collation. 

These disparities and the resulting differences in documentation among applications can create confusion when setting up a database on Windows Server.

h3. Suggested Solution
The setup wizard should create a database with a name specified by the JIRA administrator and a default collation type (SQL_Latin1_General_CP437_CI_AI).

h3. Why this is important
Ensuring a smooth setup reduces administrator burden and reduces opportunities for later difficulty.
fields.summary: Setup wizard should create/set up database when using MS SQL

*NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-64947].
{panel}
If user macros are defined in a velocity template, they can potentially be included without rendering due to a Velocity bug [https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/VELOCITY-776]

Ideally JIRA will update its internal version of Velocity1.7/VelocityTools>= 2.0 which contains the fix, released 17 JUL 2016. Currently JIRA 7.3 is shipping with V1.6.4

The workaround is put UserMacro definitions inside ./atlassian-jira/WEB-INF/classes/templates/email/macros.vm so they are defined statically.

The 2.0. release has been available since JUL 2017

- http://central.maven.org/maven2/org/apache/velocity/velocity-engine-core/2.0/

[https://dist.apache.org/repos/dist/dev/velocity/velocity-engine/2.0/release-notes.html]
fields.summary: Update Velocity Engine to 2.0+

*  !Affected version link.png|thumbnail!

fields.description:
h3. Summary

JIRA EOL check displaying an incorrect warning message
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to Support Tools screen
 # Check the "Supported Platforms"
 There's a warning message as shown below:

!EOL.png|thumbnail!
h3. Expected Results

JIRA should not display the EOL warning message.
 JIRA 7.0 has the EOL Date: Oct 6, 2017 as shown at [Atlassian Support End of Life Policy|https://confluence.atlassian.com/support/atlassian-support-end-of-life-policy-201851003.html]
h3. Actual Results

There's a warning message as shown below:
 !EOL.png|thumbnail!
  
 Checking further, I found that the file {{jira-healthcheck-eol.json}} has the wrong release date for JIRA 7.0.0 as you can see below:
{code:xml}
{"versions":[{"name":"7.3.0","releaseDate":"2017-01-03"},{"name":"7.2.0","releaseDate":"2016-08-24"},{"name":"7.1.0","releaseDate":"2016-02-10"},{"name":"7.0.0","releaseDate":"2015-09-25"}]}{code}
The correct release date for JIRA 7.0.0 should be "2015-10-06" according to the [JIRA 7.0.x platform release|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjira/jira-platform-releases/jira-7-0-x-platform-release] and not "2015-09-25".
h3. Workaround

Edit the {{jira-healthcheck-eol.json}} under the path {{JIRA-HOME/}} as shown below:
 * From:
{code:xml}
{"versions":[{"name":"7.3.0","releaseDate":"2017-01-03"},{"name":"7.2.0","releaseDate":"2016-08-24"},{"name":"7.1.0","releaseDate":"2016-02-10"},{"name":"7.0.0","releaseDate":"2015-09-25"}]}{code}

 * To:
{code:xml}
{"versions":[{"name":"7.3.0","releaseDate":"2017-01-03"},{"name":"7.2.0","releaseDate":"2016-08-24"},{"name":"7.1.0","releaseDate":"2016-02-10"},{"name":"7.0.0","releaseDate":"2015-10-06"}]}{code}
(i) If the file is not present under the path {{JIRA-HOME/}}, you can download the .json file from here [^jira-healthcheck-eol.json] and place it under the path mentioned
fields.summary: JIRA EOL check displaying an incorrect warning message

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-64932].
  {panel}

*Used Case*
1. Customer reports a ticket (Service Desk)
2. Agent reviews it and tag as a bug, improvement etc.
3. Agent creates a linked issue on the Software project and updates info, attachments etc.
4. During the development, updates on JIRA SD project ticket happen: like commenting, new attachments, customer can edit description, summary, status other fields..) for example and this update can be crucial for a developer who is working on the linked Software project. 

*Suggestion*
Imagine if this were to be done in 10+ issue. It can be a bit tedious and requires a lot of work. It would be better if there will be an auto populate feature that will update the information between the linked issues. An option to select which field should be populated is also a good idea.
fields.summary: Populate Values of Linked Issues

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-64931].
  {panel}

The [Skipping major versions when upgrading JIRA applications|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver071/skipping-major-versions-when-upgrading-jira-applications-802592265.html] documentation is currently outdated and does not mention crucial upgrade notes to take note of.

For example, when upgrading to JIRA Software 7.0, the [Upgrade notes|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftware/jira-software-7-0-x-upgrade-notes-824352098.html] mentioned that the upgrade path is *JIRA 5.1 or earlier* -> *JIRA 5.2 or later* > *JIRA Software 7.0*. Failing to comply with this will not allow the user to upgrade:
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

Another point to take note of is that if the customer is using JIRA Agile versions that are older than 6.4.0, they are unable to upgrade directly to JIRA 7.1.0 as mentioned in [This version of JIRA Agile requires a minimum build number of #45 in order to proceed|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/this-version-of-jira-agile-requires-a-minimum-build-number-of-45-in-order-to-proceed-812222943.html].

On the ServiceDesk side, the minimum version to upgrade to 3.2.0 is JIRA 7.0 and/or JIRA Service Desk 3.0 at least. This is mentioned in the [JIRA Service Desk 3.2.x release notes|https://confluence.atlassian.com/servicedesk/jira-service-desk-3-2-x-release-notes-830281732.html].
fields.summary: Update documentation in regards to Skipping major versions when upgrading JIRA applications

h3. Summary
If the project's add comment issue is restricted only to the current user when the current user assigns the issue to another user along with comments from the *Assign* button at the top of the issue screen, the issue is assigned but comments are not added to the issue.

h3. Environment
* JIRA 7.1.9, 7.2.7

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# In the project permission, grant *Add Comments* permission for *Current Assignee* and *Reporter*.
# Login to JIRA(eg: user1), Create an issue and click *Assign* in the View Issue screen.
# Assign to another user(eg: test) and add a comment.
# Login as the other user(test) and navigate to the issue created.
# Click *Assign*, enter any other user and add a comment then click *Assign*

h3. Expected Results
The issue is assigned to the target user and comment is added to the issue.

h3. Actual Results
The Issue is assigned to the target user but comment is not added

h3. Error in Logs
{code}
/secure/AssignIssue.jspa [c.a.j.issue.fields.CommentSystemField] There was an error creating a comment value: Errors: {}
Error Messages: [<username>, you do not have the permission to comment on this issue.]
{code}

h3.Workaround
Use *Assign* option from the People area in the right plane of the issue and use the comment option from the bottom of the issue screen.
fields.summary: Adding comment when assigning issue

fields.description:
h3. Summary
JIRA Data Center will skip replication operations in the current batch and mark them as applied in case of exception during reindexing 

h3. Environment
* JIRA datacenter 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Setup JIRA datacenter cluster (node1, node2)
# Do modification (create/delete/modify issue) at node1 which cause exception at node2 (not clearly identified)
# Check lucene status at node2

h3. Expected Results
Node1 and Node2 has same number of elements in Lucene and same state. 

h3. Actual Results
Node1 and Node2 has different number of elements in Lucene. 
Example from clients case:
|| - || issue count || 
| Node1 | 1506680 |
| Node2 | 1506567 |
| Node3 | 1506666 |

The error could be thrown in the logs, log should have line with *Error re-indexing node changes*:
{noformat}
2017-01-08 00:34:24,690 NodeReindexServiceThread:thread-1 ERROR      [jira.index.ha.DefaultNodeReindexService] Error re-indexing node changes
com.atlassian.jira.exception.DataAccessException: org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericDataSourceException: SQL Exception while executing the following:SELECT ID, NODE_ID, SENDING_NODE_ID, INDEX_OPERATION_ID FROM nodeindexcounter WHERE (NODE_ID =  ? ) AND (SENDING_NODE_ID =  ? ) (Query execution was interrupted)
	at com.atlassian.jira.ofbiz.DefaultOfBizDelegator.findByAnd(DefaultOfBizDelegator.java:127)
	at com.atlassian.jira.ofbiz.WrappingOfBizDelegator.findByAnd(WrappingOfBizDelegator.java:106)
	at com.atlassian.jira.index.ha.OfBizNodeIndexCounterStore.getIndexOperationCounterForNodeId(OfBizNodeIndexCounterStore.java:109)
	at com.atlassian.jira.index.ha.DefaultNodeReindexService.getCurrentIndexCount(DefaultNodeReindexService.java:324)
	at com.atlassian.jira.index.ha.DefaultNodeReindexService.reIndex(DefaultNodeReindexService.java:280)
	at com.atlassian.jira.index.ha.DefaultNodeReindexService.access$000(DefaultNodeReindexService.java:58)
	at com.atlassian.jira.index.ha.DefaultNodeReindexService$1.run(DefaultNodeReindexService.java:82)
	at java.util.concurrent.Executors$RunnableAdapter.call(Executors.java:511)
	at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.runAndReset(FutureTask.java:308)
	at java.util.concurrent.ScheduledThreadPoolExecutor$ScheduledFutureTask.access$301(ScheduledThreadPoolExecutor.java:180)
	at java.util.concurrent.ScheduledThreadPoolExecutor$ScheduledFutureTask.run(ScheduledThreadPoolExecutor.java:294)
	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1142)
	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:617)
	at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:745)
{noformat}
 
h3. Notes
If you see those errors with *Error re-indexing node changes* line that means highly likely node skipped some operations from replication table. 

h3. Note on fix
We introduced a retry mechanism, that simply stores a list of the failed operations and retries them, without any modifications, at a later time.See [Comment|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-64922?focusedCommentId=1907829&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-1907829] for more details on fix.

h3.Workaround
* Run full reindex 
* Or replicate index from another node:
# Run health-check (or empty JQL) and get status for each node
# Identify nodes(s) with maximin difference, these nodes need Lucene index to be copied from another node:
## Remove node from LB
## Copy index from another nodes to current node
fields.summary: JIRA Data Center will skip replication operations in case of index exception

fields.description:
h4. Problem

When JIRA is behind a Microsoft-based HTTP server, like IIS. JIRA functions, like page views or attempting to create an issue link, can result in a *400 Bad Request*.
h4. Steps to Reproduce
 * Setup JIRA behind IIS
 * Load an issue ticket and attempt to create an issue link
 * Browser will receive a 400 Bad Request

h4. Investigation

As of JIRA 7.3.2+, we plugin assets have been added to the request URLs. For example, when attempting to create an issue link the request looks like this:
 * JIRA 7.3.2+
{code:java}
https://mylocaljira.com/jira/s/0d089a0b9496e6961b46a6ff0fab3577-T/-2kdf3u/73014/a14cb145fcf53a0dac96c288c8cb2f1c/df1080717d136496574968aba23f1092/_/download/contextbatch/js/jira.edit.issue,-_super,-jira.view.issue,-atl.general,-jira.rich.editor,-jira.navigator.kickass,-com.atlassian.jira.plugins.jira-development-integration-plugin:devstatus-dialog-resources-ctx,-viewissue.standalone,-jira.navigator.advanced,-jira.navigator.simple,-jira.general/batch.js?agile_global_admin_condition=true&healthcheck-resources=true&is-server-instance=true&is-system-admin=true&jag=true&jaguser=true&jira-nps-enabled=true&jira.create.linked.issue=true&locale=en-US&nps-acknowledged=true&nps-not-opted-out=true&richediton=true
{code}
{code:java}
https://mylocaljira.com/jira/s/649b65f752be8a25102e4977ed4ad1b5-CDN/-7gc8qi/73013/b6b48b2829824b869586ac216d119363/9dd2b02e9d3fe3341364f22c6a6ff474/_/download/contextbatch/css/com.atlassian.jira.jira-issue-link-confluence-plugin:init-issuelink-confluence,com.atlassian.jira.jira-issue-link-remote-jira-plugin:init-issuelink-jira,-_super,-jira.view.issue,-com.atlassian.jira.plugins.jira-development-integration-plugin:devstatus-dialog-resources-ctx,-project.issue.navigator/batch.css?jira.create.linked.issue=true&richediton=true&user-logged-in=true{code}

 * JIRA 7.3.0
{code:java}
https://mylocaljira.com/jira/s/3a8c8215538460d1de361096983a5fdb-CDN/5yyz52/73011/a14cb145fcf53a0dac96c288c8cb2f1c/d07793104d5bb382d7a5a8b494b2c59a/_/download/contextbatch/js/com.atlassian.jira.jira-issue-link-remote-jira-plugin:init-issuelink-jira,-_super,-jira.view.issue,-jira.navigator.kickass,-viewissue.standalone/batch.js?jira.create.linked.issue=true&locale=en-US&richediton=true
{code}

Specifically pay attention to this section of the URL:
 * long_jira_url/download/contextbatch/js/*<EVERYTHING_HERE>*/batch.js?rest_of_url

h4. Cause

Due to the URL length increase, we are reaching the *Windows Path Limit of 260 characters*. This not the IIS URL limit. More details here:
 * [https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/aa365247(v=vs.85).aspx#maxpath]
 * [https://social.msdn.microsoft.com/Forums/en-US/723e6bfd-cab7-417b-b487-67f1dcfa524f/uri-path-great-than-260-characters-yeilds-bad-request?forum=netfxnetcom]

h4. Workaround

From the above articles, it is possible to modify the Windows Registry of the *IIS server* and increase the {{UrlSegmentMaxLength}} value to handle more characters:
 # Backup the Registry
 # With Regedit, browse to {{HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\services\HTTP\Parameters}}
 # Find the value for {{UrlSegmentMaxLength}} (or if it doesn't exist add a DWORD value), and change it to {{00001000}} (this is the hex for 4096)

Powershell alternative:
{code:java}
Set-ItemProperty -Path HKLM:\System\CurrentControlSet\Services\HTTP\Parameters -Name UrlSegmentMaxLength -Value 4096 -type DWord
{code}
After using either method to adjust the registry (Regedit or Powershell), you must restart Windows for the changes to take effect. This will necessitate downtime, please plan a maintenance window accordingly.
fields.summary: When Jira is behind a Microsoft-based HTTP server some functions can result in a 400 Bad Request error

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When performing a JQL search in two different tabs i.e. tab1, tab2. in order 1. Tab 1 and then Tab2. When you flip back to tab1 and doing bulk edit it will pull in results from tab 1 instead. 


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create three issues. One with the issue type story and two with issue type bug. 
# Open JIRA in two tabs. 
# Search issuetype = story in Tab1.
# Search issuetype = bug in Tab2. 
# Flip back to tab 1 and perform a bulk edit. 

h3. Expected Results
The bulk edit results would be from the search performed in tab 1. 
h3. Actual Results
It pulls in the results from tab 2 instead. 
 
Checking the HAR it appears to be loading from the correct JQL:

!jql.png|thumbnail!

See [^bulk.mp4]

h3.Workaround
Refresh Tab 1.
fields.summary: Bulk Edit takes results of second tab instead of initial tab where the edit is initiated.

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Site restore fails due to active objects import for some add-ons on oracle.

The import fails due to the restore attempting to create duplicate sequences in the database. This is caused by the naming of tables and columns in active objects entities used by the add-on.
h3. Environment
 * Database: Oracle 11g 11.2.0.1.0 / 11.2.0.4.0
 * Database Driver Version: 11.2.0.2.0 / 11.2.0.4.0 / 12.1.0.1.0
 * Add-on: [Smart Attachments|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.stiltsoft.jira.smart-attachments/server/overview] - others likely affected.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Install JIRA with Oracle database configured in setup.
 # Install add-on ([Smart Attachments|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.stiltsoft.jira.smart-attachments/server/overview])
 # Create XML backup
 # Restore XML backup

h3. Expected Results

All data is restored without issue as it would be on other supported databases (Postgres, MySQL, etc).
h3. Actual Results

Data restore fails when restoring active objects tables.

The below exception is thrown in the xxxxxxx.log file:
{noformat}
2017-03-22 13:07:09,192 JiraImportTaskExecutionThread-1 ERROR dmcmorris 786x603x1 4xuhp1 192.168.56.1 /secure/admin/XmlRestore.jspa [c.a.j.bc.dataimport.DefaultDataImportService] Error during ActiveObjects restore
com.atlassian.activeobjects.spi.ActiveObjectsImportExportException: There was an error during import/export with plugin Smart Attachments(com.stiltsoft.jira.smart-attachments) #1.15.1 (table AO_D4B4E5_FV_COMMENT_THREAD):Error executing update for SQL statement 'CREATE SEQUENCE "AO_D4B4E5_FV_COMMEN1480854115" INCREMENT BY 1 START WITH 1 NOMAXVALUE MINVALUE 1'
	at com.atlassian.activeobjects.backup.ImportExportErrorServiceImpl.newImportExportSqlException(ImportExportErrorServiceImpl.java:26)
	at com.atlassian.activeobjects.backup.SqlUtils.onSqlException(SqlUtils.java:46)
	at com.atlassian.activeobjects.backup.SqlUtils.executeUpdate(SqlUtils.java:37)
	at com.atlassian.activeobjects.backup.ActiveObjectsTableCreator.create(ActiveObjectsTableCreator.java:73)
	at com.atlassian.activeobjects.backup.ActiveObjectsTableCreator.create(ActiveObjectsTableCreator.java:57)
	at com.atlassian.dbexporter.importer.TableDefinitionImporter.doImportNode(TableDefinitionImporter.java:50)
	at com.atlassian.dbexporter.importer.AbstractImporter.importNode(AbstractImporter.java:44)
	at com.atlassian.dbexporter.DbImporter.importData(DbImporter.java:69)
	at com.atlassian.activeobjects.backup.ActiveObjectsBackup.restore(ActiveObjectsBackup.java:151)
	at com.atlassian.jira.bc.dataimport.DefaultDataImportService.restoreActiveObjects(DefaultDataImportService.java:583)
	at com.atlassian.jira.bc.dataimport.DefaultDataImportService.performImport(DefaultDataImportService.java:757)
	at com.atlassian.jira.bc.dataimport.DefaultDataImportService.doImport(DefaultDataImportService.java:331)
	at com.atlassian.jira.web.action.setup.DataImportAsyncCommand.call(DataImportAsyncCommand.java:60)
	at com.atlassian.jira.web.action.setup.DataImportAsyncCommand.call(DataImportAsyncCommand.java:28)
	at com.atlassian.jira.task.ImportTaskManagerImpl$TaskCallableDecorator.call(ImportTaskManagerImpl.java:157)
	at com.atlassian.jira.task.ImportTaskManagerImpl$TaskCallableDecorator.call(ImportTaskManagerImpl.java:133)
	at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.run(FutureTask.java:266)
	at java.util.concurrent.Executors$RunnableAdapter.call(Executors.java:511)
	at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.run(FutureTask.java:266)
	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1142)
	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:617)
	at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:745)
Caused by: java.sql.SQLSyntaxErrorException: ORA-00955: name is already used by an existing object
{noformat}
h3. Notes

This appears to be caused by how active objects creates sequence names in Oracle as mention in this issue:
 * [https://ecosystem.atlassian.net/browse/AO-510]

{quote}A restore of a backup fails in Oracle 11.2g due to a bug in the way sequence names are generated which causes duplicate sequences to be generated. Attached is a [patch file|https://ecosystem.atlassian.net/secure/attachment/39082/test.patch] that contains a unit test that demonstrate the problem.

This happens when:
 * there are two entities name {{A}} and {{A_B}}
 * entity {{A}} has a field named {{B_ID}},
 * entity {{A_B}} has a field named {{ID}}

The above makes a sequence for both tables named {{A_B_ID_SEQ_ID}} (which may or may not be shortened - the log snippet below is using the shortened name). 

The sequence generation {{net.java.ao.schema.DefaultSequenceNameConverter}} simply concatenates the table name and field name, which means both of the above entities generates the same sequence, and thus causing the restore to fail.
{quote}
h3. Workaround

Have the add-on developer change column names and add an upgrade task so that duplicated sequences are not generated at restoration.

(i) As a workaround to the failing XML restoration, restore using Oracle dump instead.
fields.summary: Site restore fails on Oracle with due to duplicate sequences being created by active objects

Currently, top search bar in JIRA server do not provide suggestion as how it was in JIRA Cloud

Provide same functionality as available in JIRA Cloud for top search Bar. Below is an example for current search in JIRA cloud and JIRA Server.

*JIRA Cloud*:
 !cloud search.png|thumbnail! 

*JIRA Server*:
 !jira server.PNG|thumbnail!

As many users are using JIRA it is not possible for them to remember the exact word for each of their search hence a suggestion while they are tying the words would be very helpful for the customer.

h3. Problem Definition
Currently JIRA does not provide an option to edit the E-mail templates via GUI, and the only way to edit the templates is by navigating to {{atlassian-jira/WEB-INF/classes/templates/email/}} of the <jira-application-dir> in your JIRA installation directory and manually editing those files. In addition, this form of customization is also unsupported as per the [Atlassian Support Offerings |https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/Support/Atlassian+Support+Offerings].

h3. Summary

During plugin (add-on) installs/updates (including license updates) /delete/disable action UPM will flush the large number of caches. Under high load that will cause significant JIRA performance degradation and might cause JIRA to freeze/stall for a long time.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Apply high load to JIRA
 # Upgrade any plugin.

h3. Expected Results
 * JIRA performs fast, could be slight performance degradation.
 * JIRA admin is notified about the impact

h3. Actual Results
 * JIRA admin is not notified about the impact
 * Thread dump might show the following thread *UpmAsynchronousTaskManager:thread*
{noformat}
"UpmAsynchronousTaskManager:thread-1" #38891 prio=5 os_prio=0 tid=0x00007fbda8047800 nid=0x6712 waiting on condition [0x00007fbcf9cd5000]
   java.lang.Thread.State: WAITING (parking)
	at sun.misc.Unsafe.park(Native Method)
	- parking to wait for  <0x000000056c734418> (a java.util.concurrent.locks.ReentrantReadWriteLock$NonfairSync)
...
	at net.sf.ehcache.concurrent.ReadWriteLockSync.lock(ReadWriteLockSync.java:50)
	at com.atlassian.cache.ehcache.LoadingCache.remove(LoadingCache.java:190)
	at com.atlassian.cache.ehcache.DelegatingCachedReference.reset(DelegatingCachedReference.java:79)
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.search.managers.DefaultSearchHandlerManager.refresh(DefaultSearchHandlerManager.java:290)
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.search.managers.DefaultIssueSearcherManager.refresh(DefaultIssueSearcherManager.java:46)
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.fields.DefaultFieldManager.refreshSearchersAndIndexers(DefaultFieldManager.java:804)
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.fields.DefaultFieldManager.refresh(DefaultFieldManager.java:706)
	at com.atlassian.jira.plugin.JiraCacheResetter$Delegate.resetCaches(JiraCacheResetter.java:83)
	at com.atlassian.jira.plugin.JiraCacheResetter$Delegate.onPluginModuleDisabled(JiraCacheResetter.java:53)
...
	at com.atlassian.plugin.event.impl.DefaultPluginEventManager.broadcast(DefaultPluginEventManager.java:73)
	at com.atlassian.plugin.manager.DefaultPluginManager.broadcastIgnoreError(DefaultPluginManager.java:2081)
	at com.atlassian.plugin.manager.DefaultPluginManager.publishModuleDisabledEvents(DefaultPluginManager.java:1955)
	at com.atlassian.plugin.manager.DefaultPluginManager.disablePluginModuleNoPersist(DefaultPluginManager.java:1910)
	at com.atlassian.plugin.manager.DefaultPluginManager.disablePluginModules(DefaultPluginManager.java:1904)
	at com.atlassian.plugin.manager.DefaultPluginManager.disablePluginWithModuleEvents(DefaultPluginManager.java:1860)
	at com.atlassian.plugin.manager.DefaultPluginManager.notifyPluginDisabled(DefaultPluginManager.java:1888)
	at com.atlassian.plugin.manager.DefaultPluginManager.unloadPlugin(DefaultPluginManager.java:1022)
	at com.atlassian.plugin.manager.DefaultPluginManager.uninstallNoEvent(DefaultPluginManager.java:981)
	at com.atlassian.plugin.manager.DefaultPluginManager.updatePlugin(DefaultPluginManager.java:1343)
	at com.atlassian.plugin.manager.DefaultPluginManager.addPlugins(DefaultPluginManager.java:1133)
	at com.atlassian.jira.plugin.JiraPluginManager.addPlugins(JiraPluginManager.java:150)
	at com.atlassian.plugin.manager.DefaultPluginManager.scanForNewPlugins(DefaultPluginManager.java:903)
	at com.atlassian.plugin.manager.DefaultPluginManager.installPlugins(DefaultPluginManager.java:821)
	at com.atlassian.jira.plugin.JiraPluginManager.installPlugins(JiraPluginManager.java:168)
...
{noformat}

h3. Notes

Problem is amplified at JIRA Datacenter. Cache flush is triggered during node startup as UPM needs to register and load modules from plugins. See JRASERVER-66839
h3. Workaround

Please plan any plugin actions updates/delete/disable (UPM actions) during low peak hours or maintenance windows. See [Best Practices for Managing JIRA Application Add-ons |https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/best-practices-for-managing-jira-application-add-ons-892612178.html] for recommendations.

Please provide an option how to link existing image attachment (thumbnail or link) when using the editor button 'Attachments'.

Current situation:

 - Thumbnail support is enabled.
 - A ticket has one or more image attachments.

As a user I want to link the image attachment in a comment as a clickable link, not as thumbnail.
 Example
{noformat}
[^image.png]
instead of
!image.png!
{noformat}
Currently, if the user clicks the Attachments button (in the editor and then on the desired image attachment, the wiki syntax for displaying the image as a thumbnail is being generated. However, I want to get the syntax for the clickable link.

fields.description:
h3. Problem

Upon startup, the following error is thrown in the logs:
{noformat}
JIRA Startup Failed
 
You cannot access JIRA at present. Look at the table below to identify the reasons:
 
Description
 
The following plugins are required by JIRA, but have not been started:
 
* Atlassian JIRA - Plugins - Project Config Plugin (com.atlassian.jira.jira-project-config-plugin)
* Embedded Gadgets Plugin (com.atlassian.gadgets.embedded){noformat}
This happens because the default plugin timeout limit is set too low (60 seconds). This is not always enough to load plugins into memory on lower resourced/scaling instances.
h3. Workaround

Add the JVM parameter {{-Datlassian.plugins.enable.wait=300}}

More on this here: https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/troubleshooting-jira-startup-failed-error-394464512.html
fields.summary: Plugin default timeout value not large enough, due to this JIRA can fail to start

h3. Summary  
When ever you are bulk edit issues and you have a text value in the change comment field. When you try to select the checkbox it immediately gets unchecked. However if you select it again it stays selected. 

h3. Environment
  
Happens in all browsers. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce 

# Perform a search in basic/advanced.
# Click Tools then Bulk Edit. 
# Select issues and the "Edit issues" option. 
# Drop down to change comment and text in the text field.
# Select change comment my clicking on it once. 

h3. Expected Results  
The change comment check box would stay checked on the first click. 

h3. Actual Results  
It triggers a check but then immediately is unchecked. 
[^1click_converted.mp4]

 h3.Workaround 
Click the box again and it will stay checked.

fields.description:
Due to the way JIRA commit to index on every index operation, we start seeing large instances that Lucene write operations (e.g create/edit issue) are slow waiting for QueueingIndex implementation (waiting for the writer thread to complete other running process one by one)

* Lets say we have ~_100_ issues in a queue (expected for instance with many creates/updated/deletes)
* Let's say each Lucene commit takes _10 ms_
* Then 100 issues are forced to wait ~1s ( 100 issues * 10 ms), and if they are not lucky, then they have to wait for a previous batch to be finished first (total time spent in  a queue:  1-2s)

In some cases the create issue can be as slow as 19s with the following breakdown
{quote}
23:21:54 - action not started.
23:21:56 - reindexing issue after issue created/transitioned. || Indexing thread waiting for merging thread
23:21:58 - reindexing issue after issue created/transitioned || Indexing thread is working
23:22:01 - reindexing issue after issue Created event. || Indexing thread is working
23:22:04 - Service desk setStringPropertyToIssue and reindex issue || Indexing thread is working
23:22:06 - Service desk updates SLA value, and reindex issue. Waiting for reindexing to be finished. || Index thread is working
23:22:08 - Service desk updates SLA value, and reindex issue. Waiting for reindexing to be finished. || Index thread is working
23:22:11 - processing webhooks - reading from the index
23:22:13 - processing webhooks - reading from the index
23:22:15 - processing webhooks - reading from the index
23:22:16 - End of issue create action
{quote}

Summary:
* issue create took ~19 seconds
* 4x reindexed the issue ( ~14 seconds)
* processing webhook (~ 5 seconds)

h3. Environment
* JIRA 7.2.7
* 1.5M issues + 2k custom fields + 2.5M comments and 396 projects
* ServiceDesk with (100) automation rule

h3. Verification

* Create/edit issue is slow (eg. 20s)
* Large number of threads waiting for re-index
{code:java}
grep -B 3 -A 10 'java.util.concurrent.CountDownLatch' threads/jira_threads.1489620113.txt  | awk '/http-nio-8080/{print $1}' | sort -u | wc -l
     150 
{code}
** Example of the thread waiting for reindex:
{noformat}
"http-nio-8080-exec-374 uri:/secure/QuickCreateIssue.jspa username:admin" #8603445 daemon prio=5 os_prio=0 tid=0x00007f24b40d5800 nid=0x2f47 waiting on condition [0x00007f2346ff0000]
   java.lang.Thread.State: TIMED_WAITING (parking)
	at sun.misc.Unsafe.park(Native Method)
	- parking to wait for  <0x0000000645800218> (a java.util.concurrent.CountDownLatch$Sync)
	at java.util.concurrent.locks.LockSupport.parkNanos(LockSupport.java:215)
	at java.util.concurrent.locks.AbstractQueuedSynchronizer.doAcquireSharedNanos(AbstractQueuedSynchronizer.java:1037)
	at java.util.concurrent.locks.AbstractQueuedSynchronizer.tryAcquireSharedNanos(AbstractQueuedSynchronizer.java:1328)
	at java.util.concurrent.CountDownLatch.await(CountDownLatch.java:277)
	at com.atlassian.util.concurrent.SettableFuture.get(SettableFuture.java:83)
	at com.atlassian.jira.index.FutureResult.await(FutureResult.java:38)
	at com.atlassian.jira.index.AccumulatingResultBuilder$CompositeResult.await(AccumulatingResultBuilder.java:175)
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.index.DefaultIndexManager$$Lambda$2043/398130608.await(Unknown Source)
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.index.DefaultIndexManager.obtain(DefaultIndexManager.java:815)
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.index.DefaultIndexManager.await(DefaultIndexManager.java:791)
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.index.DefaultIndexManager.reIndexIssues(DefaultIndexManager.java:571)
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.index.DefaultIndexManager.reIndexIssueObjects(DefaultIndexManager.java:468)
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.index.DefaultIndexManager.reIndex(DefaultIndexManager.java:489)
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.index.DefaultIndexManager.reIndex(DefaultIndexManager.java:473)
	at sun.reflect.GeneratedMethodAccessor1800.invoke(Unknown Source)
	at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:43)
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:498)
	at com.atlassian.jira.config.component.SwitchingInvocationHandler.invoke(SwitchingInvocationHandler.java:22)
	at com.sun.proxy.$Proxy16.reIndex(Unknown Source)
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.index.IssueIndexManager$reIndex.call(Unknown Source)
{noformat}
* Issue reindex done in batches by *ISSUE-indexQueue:thread-1*
{code:borderStyle=solid}
"ISSUE-indexQueue:thread-1" #431 prio=5 os_prio=0 tid=0x00007f22341ea000 nid=0x4f28 runnable [0x00007f18748f9000]
   java.lang.Thread.State: RUNNABLE
	at java.lang.String.intern(Native Method)
	at org.apache.lucene.util.SimpleStringInterner.intern(SimpleStringInterner.java:77)
	at org.apache.lucene.util.StringHelper.intern(StringHelper.java:39)
	at org.apache.lucene.index.FieldInfos.read(FieldInfos.java:362)
	at org.apache.lucene.index.FieldInfos.<init>(FieldInfos.java:71)
	at org.apache.lucene.index.SegmentCoreReaders.<init>(SegmentCoreReaders.java:72)
	at org.apache.lucene.index.SegmentReader.get(SegmentReader.java:114)
	at org.apache.lucene.index.IndexWriter$ReaderPool.get(IndexWriter.java:702)
	- locked <0x00000001d5ef7018> (a org.apache.lucene.index.IndexWriter$ReaderPool)
	at org.apache.lucene.index.IndexWriter$ReaderPool.get(IndexWriter.java:677)
	- locked <0x00000001d5ef7018> (a org.apache.lucene.index.IndexWriter$ReaderPool)
	at org.apache.lucene.index.BufferedDeletesStream.applyDeletes(BufferedDeletesStream.java:249)
	- locked <0x000000021a1b79b8> (a org.apache.lucene.index.BufferedDeletesStream)
	at org.apache.lucene.index.IndexWriter.doFlush(IndexWriter.java:3571)
	- locked <0x00000001e1bd7430> (a org.apache.lucene.index.IndexWriter)
	at org.apache.lucene.index.IndexWriter.flush(IndexWriter.java:3508)
	at org.apache.lucene.index.IndexWriter.prepareCommit(IndexWriter.java:3371)
	at org.apache.lucene.index.IndexWriter.commitInternal(IndexWriter.java:3444)
	- locked <0x00000001deb47cf0> (a java.lang.Object)
	at org.apache.lucene.index.IndexWriter.commit(IndexWriter.java:3426)
	at org.apache.lucene.index.IndexWriter.commit(IndexWriter.java:3410)
	at com.atlassian.jira.index.WriterWrapper.commit(WriterWrapper.java:115)
	at com.atlassian.jira.index.DefaultIndexEngine$WriterReference.commit(DefaultIndexEngine.java:239)
	at com.atlassian.jira.index.DefaultIndexEngine$FlushPolicy$2.commit(DefaultIndexEngine.java:69)
	at com.atlassian.jira.index.DefaultIndexEngine$FlushPolicy.perform(DefaultIndexEngine.java:124)
	at com.atlassian.jira.index.DefaultIndexEngine.write(DefaultIndexEngine.java:184)
	at com.atlassian.jira.index.DefaultIndex.perform(DefaultIndex.java:29)
	at com.atlassian.jira.index.QueueingIndex$Task.perform(QueueingIndex.java:132)
	- locked <0x00000001d5ef7048> (a com.atlassian.jira.index.QueueingIndex$Task)
	at com.atlassian.jira.index.QueueingIndex$Task.index(QueueingIndex.java:144)
	at com.atlassian.jira.index.QueueingIndex$Task.run(QueueingIndex.java:111)
	at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:745)
{code}

h3. Expected Results
Issue creation should be fast

h3. Actual Results
Issue creation is as slow as 20s with many thread waiting on QueueingIndex

h3. Note on fix
We stopped doing batching reads from _Queue_, now we process single element from the queue one by one. 

h3. Workaround
None
fields.summary: Commit issue in batches instead of individual operation

fields.description:
h3.  Issue Description

If the filter query for a scrum board is deemed by JIRA to be too complex and Service Desk projects exist, users outside the Service Desk Agent group are unable to manage sprints. This behavior is also present when a user has “manage sprint” permissions for every project in the instance.  

 
h3.  Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a board filter that does not specify a project which triggers a complex filter status.(ex. _customfield = value1 ORDER BY Rank ASC)_
 # Create Service Desk project
 # Grant “Manage Sprint” permission to a user on all projects.
 # Log in with the user and attempt to create/start/complete a sprint. They are unable to do so. 

h3.  Expected Results

Since the “manage sprint” permission is granted to the user for all projects that exist, the user should be able to create/start/complete sprints.
h3. Actual Results

The user is unable to create/start/complete sprints. The buttons are greyed out with a message “You need the manage sprint permission for all projects in the origin board to create a sprint”.

The “manage sprint” permission is overridden by Service Desk permissions, and requires the user to be in the “Service Desk Agent” group to manage sprints.  This occurs when a Service Desk project exists, even if no issues exist for that project.   
h3. Workaround
 # Grant users Service Desk Agent permission.

     OR

      2. Edit the board filter in a way that the Service Desk project is excluded. For example, if the board filter is:
{code:java}
assignee in membersOf(jira-administrator)
{code}
We can change to:
{code:java}
Project not in (Service Desk Project 1, Service Desk Project 2, ......) AND assignee in membersOf(jira-administrator)
{code}
fields.summary: Service Desk permissions override ‘manage sprint’ permissions

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-64898].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
User mentions don't send notification if performed by a user without Browse Users permission

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Login to JIRA with an account without 'Browse User ' permissions
# Mention another users using the wiki markup \[~user\]

h3. Expected Results
The mentioned user is linked if the username matches a JIRA username, and notifications are sent out of JIRA

h3. Actual Results
The mentioned user is linked if the username matches a JIRA username, but no notifications are sent out of JIRA

h3. Notes
In a few other contexts in JIRA it doesn't appear that the browse users permission is related to being able to trigger notifications. For instance if a user without browse users permissions updates reporter by specifying the username exactly, notifications will be sent.

h3.Workaround
No known workaround
fields.summary: Allow [^username] to send notification to user even if the input user doesn't have browse user permission.

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When adding a comment with a reference to an attachment, it is easy to accidentally cause later text in the comment to become superscripted.
h3. Environment

Chrome v 56.x, JIRA Software 7.3.1
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a new issue in any project.
 # Attach a file to the issue of any type.
 # Click *Comment*. Ensure that the visual editor is selected.
 # Click the *attachments dropdown* and select the file you just attached.
 # Type any character (for example, *q*).
 # Press backspace.
 # Press enter.
 # Add more text to the comment (for example, *hi there, hello*).

h3. Expected Results

Text appears normal.
h3. Actual Results

Text is superscripted.
h3. Notes

Was not able to reproduce issue in Firefox or IE. Does not occur with image attachments.
h3. Workaround

Select the plain "Text" editor and remove the caret symbols bracketing the superscripted text.
fields.summary: Caret symbol in attachment reference causes text in visual comment editor to superscript

fields.description:
h3. Description of problem:
When [Running JIRA Software Data Center in AWS | https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver072/running-jira-software-data-center-in-aws-857064325.html] upgrades are performed by changing the version in the AWS console. 

The only version that is currently available is 7.2.3. 
* https://s3.amazonaws.com/atlassian-software/releases/jira/atlassian-jira-software-7.2.3-x64.bin

h3. Current Behavior:
"Could not download installer"

Example: 
When attempting to upgrade to 7.2.6: "Could not download installer from https://s3.amazonaws.com/atlassian-software/releases/jira/atlassian-jira-software-7.2.6-x64.bin"

h3. Expected Behavior:
Versions of JIRA that have been publicly released are available to JIRA Data Center customers on AWS using cloudformation templates.
fields.summary: Versions after 7.2.3 not available to JIRA Data Center on AWS using Cloudformation templates

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-64888].
{panel}
h3. Problem Definition

As per the official documentation [Linking issues|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jiracoreserver073/linking-issues-861257339.html] and the KB article [How does the searching during Issue Linking works|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/how-does-the-searching-during-issue-linking-works-712641539.html], when you link an issue via the *Link* dialog box there will be both the *History Search* and *Current Search*.

!image-2017-03-21-19-22-12-288.png|thumbnail!

In the *Link* dialog, there is also an option to *search for an issue* that will allow you to search for any issues easily.

!screenshot-1.png|thumbnail!

However, if you add the *Linked Issues* field to the issue's screen. When creating or editing the screen, only the *History Search* is displayed and not the *Current Search* and *search for an issue* option, this also disables the ability to search for remote links. 

!image-2017-03-21-19-25-12-713.png|thumbnail!

!image-2017-03-21-19-25-49-384.png|thumbnail!
h3. Suggested Solution

Allow the "*Linked issues*" field to have the *Current Search* option as well as the *search for an issue* option. 
h3. Why this is important

Users will be able to conveniently link issues upon issue creation/edit without memorizing the exact issue key of the linked issues.
h3. Workaround

Select *More* > *Link* and use the Link issues dialog to link your issues.
fields.summary: The "Linked Issues" field in the issue screen should function the same as linking an issue via More > Link.

h3. Notes

You can set the default search_path at the database level:

{code}ALTER DATABASE <database_name> SET search_path TO schema1,schema2;{code}

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-64883].
  {panel}

We use email as a method for adding comments to JIRA issues.  This is an excellent method for tracking issue history, especially in "business" projects that are big on communications.  User can send emails and CC a JIRA email address to add it to a comment. Sweet. Regular users have an embedded code in their signatures and we use the "Add a comment before a specified marker" handler to truncate the user signature and message history from the saved JIRA comment.

This generally works well but it a problem with some users eg external consultants and occasional users who don't who don't use the truncation code.  An email may have one or often several images plugged into their signature, like a company logo, a facebook logo, a think-before-printing message, etc.  With an email history, they may be adding a bunch of both their and others logos in one easy/nasty hit.

In these cases, a large number of attachments can build up via an email exchange making the "real" issue content hard to see.  *These are a ***** grind to delete*.  To delete, the user must click the _bin_ icon, then wait for the confirmation screen, then click ok.  That's not a problem one-off but extremely slow and frustrating for deleting 20 attachments.

Solution 1: (quick) Allow attachments to be checked and bulk deleted on the attachments page.

Solution 2 (much better!) : Use a hash to detect duplicate attachments and only display the latest on the main issue page.  Duplicates are displayed in the attachments window and a single "Delete duplicates" button click kills all but the most recent version.

Solution 3 (even better!)  In addition to detecting and displaying only the latest attachment as above, allow attachments to be marked as junk.

Once marked as junk:
 # They are not displayed on the main issue page at all, significantly reducing clutter. :)
 # Only a single copy is kept, and this is shown in a new "junk" section/link on the attachments page.  (Marked: "These attachments are never displayed or retained")
 # It should be possible to unjunk an attachment to allow it to be displayed from then on.

_To work really nicely, the junk attachments list would be be global across the project._  If this is an issue, maybe a switch could control it?  (Allowing junk declarations across the whole instance would be quite spiffy for those pesky facebook icons but might be considered a bit of a bit of a risk and generate an authorisation problem...)

Automatic removals could be logged for audit purposes if this doesn't clutter the activity log.  And the _don't delete anything that is not in the junk library_ rule means that there is always a copy available if it is actually required.
fields.summary: Attachment Hell with emailed comments

fields.description:
h4. Summary of Issue

In the *Filter Results* gadget, when attempting to enter via the keyboard a hyphen ({{-}}) character to retrieve the list of Saved Filters, the web browser throws the following error:

{panel}
*The JIRA server was contacted but has returned an error response. We are unsure of the result of this operation.*
{panel}

h4. How to reproduce

# Install JIRA 7.1.9 (issue still occurs on 7.3.2)
#* Click on *Dashboards* >> *Manage Dashboards*
#* Click *Create new dashboard*
#* Call the dashboard *Test* and click *Add*
#* Open the *Test* Dashboard
#** Click on *Add gadget*
#*** Click *Load All*
#*** Search for *Filter* and add the *Filter Results* gadget
#** Add the 'Filter Results' gadget to the dashboard
# In the *Saved Filter:* text box, enter the some text and a hyphen character (e.g. try to enter "Resolved Filter - today")

Note: typing any punctuation mark above the numbers on the keyboard throws the same error.

h4. Expected Result

JIRA should show "No Matches" or show the list of matching Saved Filters

h4. Actual Result

The web browser (Chrome or Firefox) throws an error:

{panel}
*The JIRA server was contacted but has returned an error response. We are unsure of the result of this operation.*
{panel}

Inspecting the Network JSON response that comes back:

{code}
{"message":"org.apache.lucene.queryParser.ParseException: Cannot parse '-* ()': '*' or '?' not allowed as first character in WildcardQuery","status-code":500,"stack-trace":"com.atlassian.jira.sharing.search.SearchParseException: org.apache.lucene.queryParser.ParseException: Cannot parse '-* ()': '*' or '?' not allowed as first character in WildcardQuery\n\tat com.atlassian.jira.sharing.index.QueryBuilder.parseWildcardQuery(QueryBuilder.java:191)\n\tat com.atlassian.jira.sharing.index.QueryBuilder.addParsedWildcardQuery(QueryBuilder.java:94)\n\t...}
{code}

h4.Workaround
# Select the Saved Filter from the list of Saved Filter instead of typing it in the text box; or
# Rename the Filter so it does not contain punctuation characters

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-64878].
  {panel}

From time to time, JIRA's {{nodeassociation}} table has abandoned references between schemes and projects. This is suspected to occur if a project was deleted, but for some reason these references remain.

The integrity checker should help detect when a non-valid project ID is referenced in {{nodeassociation}} and remove the reference.

As of JIRA 7.x, for example, if there is a reference to a non-existent project, the UI will result in an error and prevent admins from modifying the schemes. The logs show:
{code}
2017-03-10 14:51:25,249 http-nio-8080-exec-46 uri:/jira/secure/admin/views/permissions/viewschemes.jsp username: admin ERROR admin 891x118804x1 1ya7wma 10.102.167.67,0:0:0:0:0:0:0:1 /secure/admin/ViewPermissionSchemes.jspa [webwork.util.ValueStack] METHOD: "projects", exception: 
java.lang.NullPointerException
	at java.util.Comparator.lambda$comparing$77a9974f$1(Comparator.java:469)
	at java.util.TimSort.binarySort(TimSort.java:296)
	at java.util.TimSort.sort(TimSort.java:239)
	at java.util.Arrays.sort(Arrays.java:1512)
	at java.util.stream.SortedOps$SizedRefSortingSink.end(SortedOps.java:348)
	at java.util.stream.Sink$ChainedReference.end(Sink.java:258)
	at java.util.stream.AbstractPipeline.copyInto(AbstractPipeline.java:482)
	at java.util.stream.AbstractPipeline.wrapAndCopyInto(AbstractPipeline.java:471)
	at java.util.stream.ReduceOps$ReduceOp.evaluateSequential(ReduceOps.java:708)
	at java.util.stream.AbstractPipeline.evaluate(AbstractPipeline.java:234)
	at java.util.stream.ReferencePipeline.collect(ReferencePipeline.java:499)
	at com.atlassian.jira.scheme.AbstractSchemeManager.getProjects(AbstractSchemeManager.java:481)
	at com.atlassian.jira.scheme.AbstractViewSchemes.getProjects(AbstractViewSchemes.java:13)
	... 2 filtered
	...
{code}

A method to look for these bad references between projects and permission/notifcation schemes is via SQL:
* For example, when looking for a permission scheme that refers to be non-existent project:
{code:borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#6A8EB3|bgColor=#F8F8F8}
SELECT * FROM nodeassociation WHERE source_node_entity='Project' AND sink_node_entity IN ('NotificationScheme', 'PermissionScheme') AND source_node_id NOT IN (select id from project);
{code}

* This will return references that have an invalid project ID (*source_node_id* column)
* This row should then be removed
fields.summary: Integrity Checker Should Check and Fix Invalid Scheme References to Removed Projects
Allow jira issue comments to support labels to aid in searching or "typecasting" comments

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Custom Field translated wrong due to invalid cache

h3. Environment
(Optional - If Applicable)

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Install JIRA 7.3.2
# Install JJUPIN 3.1.9 add-on
# Translate some Custom Fields

h3. Expected Results
JIRA display the correct translated value for the custom field

h3. Actual Results
JIRA is displaying the incorrect value for the translated custom field.
The bug appears at line 524 in CachingCustomFieldManager.java, JIRA Core sources taken from 7.3.2
{code}
byName = Multimaps.index(customFields, CustomField::getName);
{code}
The problem is that getName of the CF class takes care of the locale given by the AuthContext. If the first hit to the collection is in some other locale, you will index that and subsequent calls searching for the name and not the translation you just stored will fail.
You should use getUntranslatedName method of the CF, and not getName() in building that cache.
 
h3.Workaround
None at the moment
fields.summary: Custom Field translated wrong due to invalid cache

{noformat}
 2017-03-20 20:50:19,559 localhost-startStop-1 INFO [o.o.c.entity.jdbc.DatabaseUtil] Created declared indices for entity "ClusterNode"
 2017-03-20 20:50:19,562 localhost-startStop-1 INFO [o.o.c.entity.jdbc.DatabaseUtil] Created declared indices for entity "ClusterNodeHeartbeat"
 2017-03-20 20:50:19,808 localhost-startStop-1 ERROR [o.o.c.entity.jdbc.DatabaseUtil] Could not create declared indices for entity "ClusterUpgradeState"
 2017-03-20 20:50:19,808 localhost-startStop-1 ERROR [o.o.c.entity.jdbc.DatabaseUtil] SQL Exception while executing the following:
 CREATE INDEX ordernumber_idx ON clusterupgradestate (ORDER_NUMBER)
 Error was: com.mysql.jdbc.exceptions.jdbc4.MySQLSyntaxErrorException: Duplicate key name 'ordernumber_idx'
 2017-03-20 20:50:20,512 localhost-startStop-1 INFO [o.o.c.entity.jdbc.DatabaseUtil] Created declared indices for entity "ClusteredJob"
{noformat}

 

For postgresql below error will be thrown 
{noformat}
 2017-03-19 12:41:44,253 http-nio-8080-exec-21 ERROR anonymous 761x192x1 tmp5ef 0:0:0:0:0:0:0:1 /secure/SetupDatabase.jspa [o.o.c.entity.jdbc.DatabaseUtil] SQL Exception while executing the following:
 CREATE INDEX ordernumber_idx ON public.clusterupgradestate (ORDER_NUMBER)
 Error was: org.postgresql.util.PSQLException: ERROR: relation "ordernumber_idx" already exists
{noformat}

h3. Notes

Note that this error only present during first installation/upgrade startup for JIRA version 7.3.1 and above. It only affect *clusterupgradestate* table other table able to create the indices correctly.
h3. Workaround

Restart JIRA and new startup logs would not show this error anymore
fields.summary: Could not create declared indices for entity "ClusterUpgradeState"

fields.description:
h3. Problem

Editing the Assignee field via in line editing triggers issue updated event rather than issue assigned.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 - Remove the users on the issue assigned event on the notification scheme, leaving the issue updated event.
 - In line edit the Assignee field and assign it to an user
 - Flush the mail queue
 - Wait for the notification event on your mailbox

h3. Expected Behaviour

In line edit of the Assignee field should trigger *Issue Assigned* event.
h3. Actual Behaviour

Issue updated event is triggered rather than issue assigned event

h3. Workaround
- Disable In-line editing for Assignee field - https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/How+to+Disable+Inline+Edit+for+Assignee+Field
- Use the 'Issue Updated' event for notifications, as that event is triggered instead.

h3. Note
- Used to be fixed in JIRA 6.3.10 as per https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-29328
- Observed in Bulk Edit Assignee operation as well.
fields.summary: Editing the Assignee Field via In-line editing triggers Issue Updated event
Lock down the top menu bar

fields.description:

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-64868].
  {panel}

There should be the possibility to allow JQL requests for versions.

Therefore, why not just consider versions as parent issues? (or anything else)
 They would be "invisible" in default filters but users could eventually select a type of filter like : "issues" or "versions" in the basic filter...

This is a suggestion, please vote, improve and detail it if you like the idea.

Otherwise for a workaround :
 As versions cannot be filtered, it'd be interesting to have the possibility to trigger the automatic creation of a new issue every time the "release" button is pressed.
fields.summary: Make Versions' fields accessible for JQL filtering

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}

h3. Problem Definition
Users wanting to configure periodic scans of the log analyzer are forced to wait for a scan to complete before being able to see and click the periodic scan button to setup scheduled scans.

This used to be a separate tab and could be configured without running a scan.

h3. Suggested Solution

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When browsing JIRA in IE 11, the browser memory increases and after some time IE does not response.
h3. Environment

Internet Explorer 11.0.38, 11.0.40, 11.0.46, 11.0.96.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Access JIRA using IE 11
 # Turn on F12 development tools, switch to Memory tab, and [Start profiling|https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/dn255003(v=vs.85).aspx]
 # Navigate to different JIRA pages (e.g. browse multiple projects/dashboards one by one)
 # Notice an increase in memory usage for every page change

h3. Expected Behavior

IE 11 garbage collection should kick in and free up memory periodically.
h3. Actual Behavior

IE 11 continues to consume system memory until it eventually crashes:

!IEmem.png|thumbnail!
h3. Notes
 * This issue is very similar to CONF-38182.
 * IE 11 and Edge are known to have memory leaks as described in [this bug report|https://developer.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoft-edge/platform/issues/8020622/].
fields.summary: Potential memory leak in Internet Explorer 11 leading to performance issues
Enable issue notification for external e-mails

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Copy and pasting JIRA emoticons such as (/) or (x) from another issue can lead to the URL for the image instead of the macro being pasted. On subsequent edits the URL for the emoticon image gets currupted leading to an error in the field/comment:
{noformat}
Unable to render embedded object: File (/jira/images/icons/emoticons/check.png) not found.
{noformat}
h3. Environment
 * Reproduced in Safari and Chrome (mac)

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Copy only the (/) image from an existing issue without any additional spaces or text.
 # Paste this into the visual tab of the field/comment editor
 # If you look at the text tab now you will see the full URL of the check.png file instead of (/)
 # Save the changes
 # Everything will display correctly because the full URL is there.
 # Edit the field again
 # Using the visual tab, add or remove text (if you edit with the text tab, this problem will not occur)
 # Save the changes
 # You will now see the error

h3. Expected Results

Emoticons should appear as macros not image attachements when pasted. If pasted as image attachments, their URLs should not be altered on subsequent edits and the images should continue to appear and render properly.
h3. Actual Results

After subsequent edits and sometimes the initial paste, the emoticons will fail to render and instead be replaced by the following error:
{noformat}
Unable to render embedded object: File (/jira/images/icons/emoticons/check.png) not found.
{noformat}
h3. Notes

Reproduced in this issue here below, take a look at history tab for how the contents are changed:
 (/) working emoticon

Unable to render embedded object: File (/images/icons/emoticons/check.png) not found. Paste fails in JAC as well.
h3. Workaround

You can avoid this issue by:
 * Only copying and pasting emoticons with additional text
 * Only editing the field/comment using the text tab

Once the error is displayed you can edit the field/comment to replace the image macro with the proper emoticon macro.
fields.summary: Pasting emoticons into visual tab of rich text editor can lead to Unable to render embedded object errors

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}

h3. Problem Definition

Right now it's only possible to add images(using control+v) in an issue with a new comment. The customers want to be able to add new images while editing a comment.

Note that this feature is presented in JIRA Service Desk already.

There are customers whose daily job includes editing other users comments and this would be an important feature for then.
