fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-64857].
  {panel}

h4. Problem
Index snapshots are not based on the server timezone, but based on the configured "Default user time zone".

h4. Steps to Reproduce
# Navigate to: JIRA Admin > System > General Configuration 
# Modify the "Default user time zone" to be different than the "System default"
** In my test, system default is GMT +11, I'll be changing it to be GMT -6
# Enable Index Snapshots and set a time
** Notice that the server time is presented, which is *not* the "Default user time zone":
!index-snapshot-setting.png|thumbnail!
** In this case, we set it to 11:00am server time, which is GMT +11
# Wait until an index snapshot is run
# Notice that it does not run during the specified time, which the UI indicates.
# Realize later that the snapshot is taken during 11:00am GMT -6
{code}
[server]...-home/export/indexsnapshots❯ ll
total 8336
drwxrwxr-x 2 dos dos    4096 Mar 18 03:09 ./
drwxrwxr-x 4 dos dos    4096 Mar 18 02:39 ../
-rw-rw-r-- 1 dos dos 8525140 Mar 18 03:00 IndexSnapshot_2017-Mar-18--0300.zip

[server]...-home/export/indexsnapshots❯ timedatectl
      Local time: Sat 2017-03-18 03:21:47 AEDT
  Universal time: Fri 2017-03-17 16:21:47 UTC
        Timezone: Australia/Sydney (AEDT, +1100)
{code}

h4. Expected Behaviour
* The index configurations showed server time using GMT +11
* It's expected that the snapshot is created during the specified 11:00am GMT +11

h4. Actual Behaviour
* Index snapshot is taken at 3:00am GMT +11
* Snapshot did not use the specified server time, but instead used "Default user time zone"
fields.summary: Index Snapshot Scheduler is Using Incorrect TimeZone

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}

A configuration in the admin area would be great.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-64851].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
In case you have many application connected to JIRA through Application link and they all have same name: _Crucible + Fisheye_, _Confluence_ it will be hard to use proper one. 

IRA will use name from remote Applink server and it's not possible to change name.  Data loaded dynamically from cached remote response. From documentation page regarding *Application Navigator*: [Creating+links+in+the+application+navigator|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AdminJIRAServer072/Creating+links+in+the+application+navigator] 

Please note this comment:
bq.  ... You cannot delete links to linked applications, you must delete the application link instead. 


h3. Suggested Solution
Add option to change Name Application name links in Application Navigator

h3. Workaround 
Based on feedback from the client:
# Make those navigators hidden.
# Add different navigators using different name but same URLs
#* application navigator are just for navigation and changes made in above 2 steps won't affect anything else.
fields.summary: As an JIRA Administrator I want change name for Application name links in Application Navigator

fields.description:
h3. Summary
According to [this documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRASOFTWARESERVER073/Advanced+searching+-+fields+reference#Advancedsearching-fieldsreference-CreatorCreator], WAS, WAS IN, WAS NOT, WAS NOT IN are supported operators for the syntax {{creator}}. However, searching with JQL query like {{creator was admin}} returns the error
{quote}
History searches do not support the 'creator' field
{quote}

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to the Issue Navigator.
# Switch to the Advanced mode.
# Search with JQL query: {{creator was admin}}

h3. Expected Results
May or may not return any results depending on the data, but without error on the Issue Navigator.

h3. Actual Results
Error *History searches do not support the 'creator' field* appears on the Issue Navigator.
 
h3. Notes
* Creator cannot be changed in JIRA, should we even support the operators "WAS", "WAS IN", "WAS NOT" and "WAS NOT IN"?
fields.summary: History searches do not support the 'creator' field

fields.description:
*Steps to reproduce:*
 # Go to General Configuration
 # Change Indexing Language to _German_
 # Change Default Language to _Deutsch (Deutschland)_
 # Change Default user time zone to _Europe_ and Timezone to _(GMT+01:00) Berlin_
 # Change any date picker field (e. g Due Date) to any date in March (e.g 4/Mrz/15 10:25 PM)

*Expected Result:*
 - JIRA should be able to recognize "Mrz" abbreviation for March

*Actual Result:*

*!march.png|thumbnail!*

*Possible Workaround:*
 - Change the date format from _20/Mrz/15_ to _20.03.15_ with the below setting in _Advanced Settings_:
{noformat}jira.date.picker.javascript.format=%d.%m.%y
jira.date.time.picker.javascript.format=%d.%m.%y %H:%M
jira.date.time.picker.java.format=d.MM.yy H:mm
jira.date.picker.java.format=d.MM.yy
{noformat}

 - Change date manually to 20/Mär/15 or 20/März/17
fields.summary: JIRA doesn't recognize "Mrz" abbreviation for March in German in Server

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-64848].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

# We suspect stems from JIRA not handling Microsoft Office attempting to ascertain whether it can edit the file directly via WebDAV, and stripping URL-encoded spaces too early, which can be seen from the fact that Nginx says that it requests the URL with URL-encoded spaces
# In Hercules on 7.2.2. , there are 4 hits for 
https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/nullpointerexception-when-authenticating-from-ie-216959513.html?utm_medium=logScan&utm_source=STP 
# From the JIRA log, we see: 
{code}
2017-03-07 08:15:30,382 http-nio-8180-exec-24 ERROR anonymous 495x111348x1 - X.X.X.X,X.X.X.X /secure/attachment/XXXXX/FILE%20ABC%20DEF%20GHI.docx [c.a.j.web.servlet.ViewAttachmentServlet] Error serving file for path /XXXXX/FILE ABC DEF GHI.docx: Illegal character in path at index 31: /secure/attachment/XXXXX/FILE ABC DEF GHI.docx
{code}
...with Nginx in front of it, on another machine, says
{code}
[07/Mar/2017:08:15:30 +0100] "HEAD /secure/attachment/XXXXX/FILE%20ABC%20DEF%20GHI.docx HTTP/1.1" 500 0 "-" "Microsoft Office Existence Discovery"
{code}
# It would seem, that JIRA (+Nginx?) is having trouble with Microsoft Office attempting to ascertain whether it can save directly to the file.
# Entering the attachment URL directly in Firefox serves the file with no problem and nothing in the JIRA log.
# From the Nginx access log :
{code:borderStyle=solid}
X.X.X.X - - [15/Mar/2017:15:50:54 +0100] "GET /secure/attachment/YYYYY/PQR%20STU%20VWX%20YZ.xlsx HTTP/1.1" 200 12041 "<jira-base-url>/browse/KEY-123" "Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; WOW64; Trident/7.0; rv:11.0) like Gecko"
X.X.X.X - - [15/Mar/2017:15:50:55 +0100] "OPTIONS /secure/attachment/YYYYY/ HTTP/1.1" 200 0 "-" "Microsoft Office Protocol Discovery"
X.X.X.X - - [15/Mar/2017:15:50:55 +0100] "OPTIONS /secure/attachment/YYYYY/ HTTP/1.1" 200 0 "-" "Microsoft Office Excel 2013 (15.0.4805) Windows NT 6.1"
X.X.X.X - - [15/Mar/2017:15:50:56 +0100] "HEAD /secure/attachment/YYYYY/PQR%20STU%20VWX%20YZ.xlsx HTTP/1.1" 500 0 "-" "Microsoft Office Excel 2013 (15.0.4885) Windows NT 6.1"
X.X.X.X - - [15/Mar/2017:15:50:56 +0100] "OPTIONS /secure/attachment/ HTTP/1.1" 200 0 "-" "Microsoft Office Excel 2013 (15.0.4805) Windows NT 6.1"
X.X.X.X - - [15/Mar/2017:15:50:56 +0100] "HEAD /secure/attachment/YYYYY/PQR%20STU%20VWX%20YZ.xlsx HTTP/1.1" 500 0 "-" "Microsoft Office Existence Discovery"

Take note of the user agent "Microsoft Office Protocol Discovery" - it would seem the Office application attempts to ascertain whether it can edit the document directly via WebDAV or some-such - the 500 is coming from JIRA, which seems to, somehow, strip the URL encoding of the path a bit too early (or Nginx does it), since JIRA complains about spaces in the URL, as per:

2017-03-15 15:50:56,305 http-nio-8180-exec-12 ERROR anonymous 950x555726x1 - X.X.X.X,X.X.X.X /secure/attachment/YYYYY/PQR%20STU%20VWX%20YZ.xlsx [c.a.j.web.servlet.ViewAttachmentServlet] Error serving file for path /YYYYY/PQR STU VWX YZ.xlsx: Illegal character in path at index 35: /secure/attachment/YYYYY/PQR STU VWX YZ.xlsxjava.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Illegal character in path at index 35: /secure/attachment/YYYYY/PQR STU VWX YZ.xlsx
{code}


h3. Environment
* JIRA 7.2.2
* Nginx
fields.summary: False positive in Hercules log scanner for Microsoft Office files

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-64847].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
If in some case when many cache flush events are generated (see JRA-64839) all those events are blocking events. During that time cache is not usable and if this is hot cache that degrades JIRA performance. 

Following sequence will happen:
# Cache flush events generated in loop - _Thread1_ 
# Cache will be flushed - _Thread1_ 
#* If this is a hot cache, there will be attempt to populate it - _Thread2_
#* Thread will try to flush cache but will be blocked - _Thread1_ 
# Cache population is done - _Thread2_
# Cache will be flushed - _Thread1_ 
# Repeat until all cache events are done. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Make jira cache flush events non-blocking

JRASERVER-67019 makes cache flush less coupled for DC. 

h3. Workaround 
None
fields.summary: Make jira cache flush events non-blocking
